âUnpretentious, pacy and genuinely wittyâ¦ I MARRIED A WITCH sees Clair at his peak, with an ambitious, puritanical politician (March) being plagued by the mischievous Lake, a witch reincarnated and bent on revenge after being burned at the stake by his ancestors. Lake is delightfully effective as the malicious woman, whose ideas of punishment are often beautifully absurd, and March provides an excellent foil.â
â Gilbert Adair, Time Out
